objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the 'Smooth Operator' malware analysis report. The report is under Crown Copyright, and NCSC is credited with authoring the YARA rules and publishing prior security advice on the 3CX incident.

objects.name: Smooth Operator Lock File
objects.description: File lock created by Smooth Operator to ensure only one instance is running.
objects.pattern: [file:name = '.session-lock' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '$HOME/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/']

objects.name: Smooth Operator Storage File
objects.description: File used by Smooth Operator to store the victim ID and next scheduled beacon time.
objects.pattern: [file:name = '.main_storage' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '$HOME/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/']

objects.name: Smooth Operator Second-Stage Payload Path
objects.description: File path where the second-stage payload 'UpdateAgent' is written before execution.
objects.pattern: [file:name = 'UpdateAgent' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '$HOME/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/']

objects.name: Fallback C2 URL
objects.description: Legitimate 3CX URL used as a fallback C2 server if other C2s fail.

objects.name: Exfiltration URL
objects.description: URL used by the second-stage payload to exfiltrate victim data.

objects.name: Exfiltration Domain
objects.description: Domain used by the second-stage payload to exfiltrate victim data.

objects.name: Indicator for Trojanized 3CX DMG (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the trojanized, signed, and notarized 3CX software package 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg.

objects.name: Indicator for Trojanized 3CX DMG (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the trojanized, signed, and notarized 3CX software package 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg.

objects.name: Indicator for Trojanized 3CX DMG (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the trojanized, signed, and notarized 3CX software package 3CXDesktopApp-18.12.416.dmg.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator First-Stage (libffmpeg.dylib) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious libffmpeg.dylib, the first-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator First-Stage (libffmpeg.dylib) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious libffmpeg.dylib, the first-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator First-Stage (libffmpeg.dylib) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious libffmpeg.dylib, the first-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator Second-Stage (UpdateAgent) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UpdateAgent binary, the second-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator Second-Stage (UpdateAgent) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the UpdateAgent binary, the second-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: Indicator for Smooth Operator Second-Stage (UpdateAgent) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the UpdateAgent binary, the second-stage payload of Smooth Operator.

objects.name: smooth operator
objects.description: A two-stage macOS malware distributed as part of the 3CX supply chain attack. The first stage is compiled into a dynamic library (libffmpeg.dylib) and is responsible for downloading and executing a second-stage payload. It uses HTTPS for C2 communication, obfuscates exfiltrated data with a custom encoding algorithm, and can receive tasking to run payloads, sleep, or exit. It persists as part of the compromised 3CX software.

objects.name: updateagent
objects.description: The second-stage payload of the Smooth Operator malware. Its primary function is to exfiltrate victim-specific data from the 3CX 'config.json' file, including domain and account names. Upon execution, it daemonises, detaches from the parent 3CX process, and immediately deletes itself from disk to evade detection.

objects.name: 3CX
objects.description: The company whose software was compromised in a supply chain attack. Trojanised versions of the 3CX Desktop App were distributed to victims through legitimate update channels.

objects.name: Apple
objects.description: The company that notarized the infected 3CX software package, which allowed the malicious software to bypass certain macOS security checks upon installation.

objects.name: Supply Chain Compromise: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
objects.description: Smooth Operator is distributed via legitimate channels as trojanised, signed and notarized 3CX software.

objects.name: Compromise Client Software Binary
objects.description: Smooth Operator runs as part of the 3CX software.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Smooth Operator uses a custom algorithm to obfuscate data exfiltrated over the C2 channel. Smooth Operator deobfuscates data it writes to a file on disk as well as tasking responses.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: Smooth Operator’s second-stage deletes itself from disk immediately on execution.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
objects.description: Smooth Operator sleeps for, at minimum, a week before beaconing.

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Smooth Operator stages collect data from the victim machine to be included in a beacon or exfiltration.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Smooth Operator command and control is over HTTPS.

objects.name: Fallback Channels
objects.description: Smooth Operator contains multiple C2 servers and randomly chooses a new server from the list for each beacon, if one fails it will try another.

objects.name: Automated Exfiltration
objects.description: Smooth Operator exfiltrates automatically collected data, not over the existing C2 channel.

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique strings and code
present in the C2 string obfuscation code of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:

    $ = {48 69 ?? 61 60 60 60 48 89 ?? 48 C1 EA 3F 48 C1 ?? 25 01

?? 6B ?? 55}

$ = "!#$%&()*+-

.0123456789:;<>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[]_abcdefghi"
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26706572} // &per
$ = {3E00C7[5-6]26646F6C} // &dol
$ = {75733E00C7[5-6]26706C75} // &plus
$ = {6D693E00C7[5-6]2673656D} // &semi

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Obfuscation_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies unique code sections in the
C2 string obfuscation algorithm."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"
        hash2 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $a_1 = {4869C8616060604889CA48C1EA3F48C1F92501D16BC95529C8[0-
3]83F807}
        $b_1 = {438D1C24F7DB41F7DC} // neg
        $b_2 = {478D3C3641F7DF41F7DE} // neg

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of ($b*) and $a_1
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies broader functionality across
Smooth Operator, identifying strings observed throughout."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:
        $ = {80 [2] 7A 48 FF C0 48 83 F8 38} // .main_storage XOR loop
        $ = "<key>ProductVersion</key>"
        $ = ".session-lock"
        $ = "%s/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/UpdateAgent"
        $ = {3715001316161B554F544A5A522D13141E150D095A342E5A4B4A544A415A2D13144C4E415A024C4E535A3B0A0A161F2D1F1831130E554F494D54494C5A5231322E3736565A1613111F5A3D1F191115535A39120815171F554B4A42544A544F494F43544B48425A291B1C1B0813554F494D54494C} // XOR'd UA
        $ = {B02D[0-8]88470888470D884712884717C6472400} // victim ID generation

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 4 of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_C2_codes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_C2_codes {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies sections of code which are
responsible for parsing tasking command codes in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ = {80340F7A48FFC14839C8} // XOR deobfuscate tasking

        $ = {8B073D4938000074??3D018000008B4C24??0F[3-6]3D01900000} // C2 codes

    condition:

((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and all of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_Sleeps
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_Sleeps {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies algorithms used by the
malware developer to generate random time values in Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "769383fc65d1386dd141c960c9970114547da0c2"

    strings:

$ = {E8[4]E8[4]89C14869C93FC5254348C1E9246BC93D29C86BE83C81C5100E0000B80F000000} // between beacon time generation

$ = {E8[4]E8[4]89C1490FAFCE48C1E9238D0C898D0C4929C8} // C2 index
$ = {89E8D1E841BE932449924C0FAFF049C1EE224489F0C1E0044489F129C14101EE4101CE488DBC24[4]4C892FE8} // initial sleep

    condition:
        ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or
(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and any of them
}

objects.name: Smooth_Operator_II
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule Smooth_Operator_II {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies strings observed in the
second stage of Smooth Operator."
        date = "2023-06-29"
        hash1 = "9e9a5f8d86356796162cee881c843cde9eaedfb3"

    strings:
        $ = "3cx_auth_id=%s;3cx_auth_token_content=%s;__tutma=true"

  $ = "AccountName\":"

        $ = "url\": \"https://"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/.main_storage"
        $ = "%s/Library/Application Support/3CX Desktop App/config.json"
        $ = "read_config"
        $ = "enc_text"
        $ = "send_post"
        $ = "parse_json_config"

    condition:

    ((uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACF) or (uint32(0) == 0xFEEDFACE) or

(uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABE) or (uint32(0) == 0xCAFEBABF)) and 5 of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Smooth Operator
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. smooth operator.
